sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The maxcol function is used to determine the number of columns on the screen.
sections.text_content: The maxcol function is used to determine the number of columns on the screen.
sections.mdown_content: The **maxcol** function is used to determine the number of columns on the screen.

sections.title: Example
code: put "Number of columns on the screen is ", maxrow
sections.raw_content: This program outputs the maximum column number.
sections.text_content: This program outputs the maximum column number.
sections.mdown_content: This program outputs the maximum column number.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: For IBM PC compatibles as well as most UNIX dumb terminals, in "text" or "screen" mode, maxcol = 80. For the default IBM PC compatible "graphics" mode (CGA), maxcol = 40.
sections.text_content: For IBM PC compatibles as well as most UNIX dumb terminals, in "text" or "screen" mode, maxcol = 80. For the default IBM PC compatible "graphics" mode (CGA), maxcol = 40.
sections.mdown_content: For IBM PC compatibles as well as most UNIX dumb terminals, in "_text_" or "_screen_" mode, **maxcol** = 80. For the default IBM PC compatible "_graphics_" mode (CGA), **maxcol** = 40.
